DOC.brief_summary: Exploratory study on blood-borne biological markers and their correlation with clinical and pathological characteristics.
DOC.brief_title: Analysis of Circulating Tumor Markers in the Blood (ALCINA)
DOC.detailed_description: Exploratory multi-cohort study including different types of cancer (different organs and/or different histological types). Each kind of blood-borne biological markers analyses corresponds to a cohort.
DOC.criteria: 1. Patient with any tumoral disease (proven or suspected), of any type and stage 2. More than18 years old 3. Signed informed consent form Additional inclusion criteria if a tumor sample is needed: 4. Tumor considered as accessible by biopsy 5. Normal blood coagulation tests on the last blood analysis Noninclusion Criteria: 1. Patient in detention or protected by the law 2. Patient who cannot comply with the study follow up for geographical, social or psychological reasons Additional noninclusion criteria if a tumor sample is needed: 3. Anticoagulant or antiaggregant that cannot be interrupted for the biopsy 4. centralnervous system metastases only (unless a diagnostic or curative surgery is planned before the inclusion in the study)
